intro: Sphaerostephanos ellipticus, commonly known as the elliptic star-fruit, is a member of the Oxalidaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped yellow flowers. The plant produces edible, bright red berries that are often used in culinary applications. Native to South America, it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Its unique morphology and ornamental value make it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
